author: Suvojit Bagchi
text:
In the wake of the illegal construction of a large building in the East Kolkata Wetlands by an organisation functioning under Sri Sri Ravi Shankar’s The Art of Living Foundation, special adviser to the International Union for Conservation of Nature Dhrubajyoti Ghosh has written to the AoL founder.

In his letter, Mr. Ghosh, also a former Chief Environment Officer of the State government, pointed out that since the wetland is a Ramsar Site, any construction on it is illegal. The Ramsar Convention is an internationally accepted treaty to protect and conserve wetlands.

“The wetland is further protected by the East Kolkata Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Act since 2006 and by a 1992 Calcutta High Court judgment that has made any construction within the 12,500 hectare area illegal. To set up a building within this wetland is a travesty of law,” Mr. Ghosh said.

A noted environmental activist, who mapped and named the wetland, Mr. Ghosh urged the AoL founder to stop the construction.

“Sadly, a permanent building has been constructed within this protected area. To be on the right side of law, I hope this wrongful construction will be demolished by the Trust that has built it,” said Mr. Ghosh.

title: AoL accused of flouting green laws in Bengal
